incidents.name: Errors With Multiple Twilio Products

incident_updates.body: All services impacted by an issue with Flex have recovered and are operating as intended. This incident has been resolved.

We are still observing recovery across Flex products and features. Error rates have normalized, and we will continue to closely monitor for an extended period to ensure the recovery is sustained and complete. We will provide another update in 30 minutes or as soon as we have more information available.

We continue observing recovery across Flex products and features. Error rates have normalized, and we will continue to closely monitor for an extended period to ensure the recovery is sustained and complete. We will provide another update in 15 minutes or as soon as we have more information available.

We have identified and addressed the issue causing impact across Flex products, and we are observing continued recovery across Flex products and features. Error rates have normalized, and we will continue to closely monitor for an extended period to ensure the recovery is sustained and complete. We will provide another update in 15 minutes or as soon as we have more information available.

We are experiencing issues with Multiple Flex products, including:

Flex: Flex agents will be unable to login into Flex UI. Both Single-sign on and Console logins are impacted. Tasks will not be created, existing tasks cannot be routed to available workers; and agent state can not be changed. Flex Messaging Channels are down. Flex Copilot is also impacted. All Flex calls using Voice are impacted. Calls that were in-progress prior to the incident will not be impacted.

Studio: Customers will experience increased SendToFlex widget failures when calling Task Router to create Tasks.

After further investigation, we can confirm customers are able to log in to the Twilio Console. Our engineering team is actively working to resolve the issue. We expect to provide another update in 15 minutes or as soon as more information becomes available.

We are experiencing issues with multiple Twilio products including: Flex TaskRouter, Console Logins, Studio, and Voice Services. Customers could not be able to log in though Twilio Console. Our engineering team is actively working to resolve the issue. We expect to provide another update in 15 minutes or as soon as more information becomes available.
Our monitoring systems have detected a potential issue TaskRouter and Voice. Our engineering team has been alerted and is actively investigating. We will update as soon as we have more information.

incidents.name: CNAME and a Record Conflict Bug Blocked DNS Validation

incident_updates.body: Twilio DNS Validation was degraded for 2 days between 07/08/2025 and 07/10/2025. During this period of time customers may have experienced DNS validation wrongfully blocking requests or uploads for certs when using subdomains. Approximately 28 subdomains were blocked from requesting/uploading cert. The issue has now been resolved.

incidents.name: Ireland Alphanumeric Senders traffic blocked with error 30007

incident_updates.body:
Following a regulatory change in Ireland on July 3rd 2025, some alphanumeric senders are overwritten with "Likely SCAM" for SMS delivery. However between 2025-07-07 at 10:01:38 am EST and 2025-07-10 at 10:40:04 am EST, some of these messages were unintentionally blocked with error 30007. The issue has been resolved and all overwritten senders are now processing normally.
To avoid your message being modified with "Likely SCAM", please [follow these steps link1 and link 2]. 
Link 1: https://help.twilio.com/articles/33333263397787-Documents-Required-and-Instructions-to-Register-Your-Alphanumeric-Sender-ID-in-Ireland
Link 2: https://help.twilio.com/articles/37313903785755: 
The issue has now been resolved.

incidents.name: Issue with Call Dialing Delays to Multiple Carriers in Egypt

incident_updates.body: Twilio Voice was degraded between 07:36 and 15:40 Pacific Time on 07/07/2025. During this period of time customers may have experienced call dialing delays to multiple carriers in Egypt. The issue has now been resolved.

affected_components.name: CARRIER NETWORK - Voice, Middle East & Africa

incident_updates.body: Our engineers are currently investigating the customer impact of a retroactive issue with call dialing delays to multiple carriers in Egypt. We will follow up and provide customer impact details within 2 hours.

affected_components.name: CARRIER NETWORK - Voice, Middle East & Africa

incidents.name: 5xx's from Programmable Messaging API

incident_updates.body: The Twilio Programmable Messaging API was partially degraded for 13 minutes on July 8, 2025 between 10:42 PST and 10:55 PST. During this period of time, customers may have received elevated volumes of 5xx's in API responses. This issue has now been resolved.

incidents.name: Errors Making GET Requests to the Programmable Voice Calls API

incident_updates.body: Twilio Voice API was degraded for 14 minutes between 09:28 and 09:42 Pacific Time on 07/08/2025. During this period of time customers may have experienced increased HTTP 500s when making GET requests to the Programmable Voice Calls API endpoints for completed calls. Call creation and in-progress calls were not affected. The issue has now been resolved.

incidents.name: Serverless Customers Receiving Errors When Invoking Functions

incident_updates.body: The issue affecting intermittent Serverless customers receiving 429 (rate limit) errors when invoking functions has been resolved, and the service is functioning normally at this time.

We have started seeing recovery for intermittent issue with Serverless customers receiving 429 (rate limit) errors when invoking functions, and the rate limiting is taking place according to customers' configured Account Limits. We will continue to monitor to ensure a full recovery. We expect to provide another update in 30 minutes or as soon as more information becomes available.

We are aware of an issue with Serverless customers receiving 429 (rate limit) errors when invoking functions, and the rate limiting is taking place according to customers' configured Account Limits. Our engineering team has been alerted and is actively working to handle a surge in traffic. We will share an update in 30 minutes or as soon as we have more information

Our monitoring systems have detected a potential issue with Serverless functions returning 429s Our engineering team has been alerted and is actively investigating. We will update as soon as we have more information.

incidents.name: Spike in 5xx errors Affecting Conversations and Sync in IE1 Region

incident_updates.body: Twilio Conversations and Sync in the IE1 region was degraded for 4 minutes between 04:18 and 04:22 Pacific Time on 07/07/2025. During this period of time the customers may have experienced higher than normal latency and may have experienced a spike in 5xx errors. The issue has now been resolved.
